tools.name: docs
tools.description:
Gets the documentation for an internal package or function. This should be the first place to look for how something works.

IMPORTANT: Before running a specific test, use this tool to verify:
1. The exact test function name exists in the package
2. The correct naming convention (Test_functionName_scenario with underscores)
3. Available test scenarios for a function

package.title: Package Path
package.description: Package of the function or struct to get documents for. For tests, use the test file path (e.g., ./internal/services/dsrs).

function.title: Function Name
function.description: Function to get information about. Can be a package level function SomeFunction or a struct SomeStruct, or a struct function SomeStruct.StructFunction. For test functions, include 'Test_' prefix. Leave empty to get package level docs.

tools.name: format
tools.description:
Formats the code according to the specified style guide.

This command runs 'make fmt' to format all code in the project according to the configured style guide.

package.title: Package Path
package.description: Specific package or file to format (e.g., dir1 | dir2/... | file.go). Leave empty to format all packages.

tools.name: lint
tools.description: Runs the linter on the code

package.title: Package Path
package.description: Specific package or file to lint (e.g., dir1 | dir2/... | file.go). Leave empty to lint all packages.

tools.name: run_tests
tools.description:
Run the test suite for the project.

IMPORTANT: Test names in this project follow the pattern Test_functionName_scenario (with underscores), NOT TestFunctionName.
Before running a specific test, use the 'docs' tool or grep to verify the exact test name exists in the package.

Args:
    package: Required package path to test (e.g., ./internal/services/dsrs)
    test: Optional test name pattern. Use Go test regex patterns:
          - Test_functionName (runs all scenarios for that function)
          - Test_functionName_scenario (runs specific scenario)
          - Test_functionName_scenario/subtest (runs specific subtest)

Returns:
    Test results and coverage information

test.title: Test Name Pattern
test.description: Optional test name pattern (e.g., Test_ProcessJob or Test_ProcessJob_success). Leave empty to run all tests in the package. IMPORTANT: Test names use underscores (Test_name_scenario), not camelCase (TestNameScenario).
